President Trump has personally assured me that the hardworking men and women who feed and clothe the American people will continue to have his steadfast support. He has been true to his word and I, along with our farmers and ranchers, am grateful for his commitment.

I am very pleased that the President has announced a $16 billion trade assistance package to provide some tariff-related relief for our farmers while he holds China accountable and forces them to play by the same rules as other countries.

We must achieve two things: 1) give the President the runway to force China to a fairer deal, and 2) ensure our producers and manufacturers can stay in business until we get to the other side of this negotiation. Go WTX!

We need this updated and improved trade deal, USMCA, to continue our historic job growth. On a side note:  I am confident we’ll get some support from @POTUS (with help from Congress) to provide some relief to our farmers who are suffering through this tariff battle with China.

Had a good meeting today with Ambassador Lighthizer and bipartisan group of Texans for trade. I am encouraged by the progress on #USMCA. Our trade relationship with Canada and Mexico represents $120b and an 800% increase in agriculture trade since 1993. pic.twitter.com/twRQYf3EME
